data.event: It will be held Friday from 7:30 to 9:30 p.m. at Mittineague Park.
April presents some interesting celestial scenes.

event.title: will host "Stars Over Springfield" on Friday

data.event: The Springfield Science Museum will host "Stars Over Springfield" on Friday at 7:30 p.m.

Amherst College's Wilder Observatory open house at 9 p.m. on Saturday will give people a chance to use the 6-ton Clark Refractor as well as smaller telescopes set up by the Amherst Area Amateur Astronomy Association.

event.title: Sunday, astronomers, amateur astronomers and anyone interested in stars and planets will gather

data.event: From Thursday through Sunday, astronomers, amateur astronomers and anyone interested in stars and planets will gather to point telescopes skyward.

Advancements by Galileo Galilei, born in Italy around 1564, include making significant improvements to the telescope and astronomical observation, discovering moons of Jupiter, and defending Copernicus's theory that the Earth revolved around the sun, in contrast to the teachings of the Roman Catholic church.
